<letter id="jbu3903">
<recipient first="Francis" last="Marion" type="individual"/>
<p>
HEAD-QUARTERS, <a rel="month origin" value="9">September</a> <a rel='day origin' value='18'>18</a>, <a href='/results.php?year=1782' rel="origin">1782</a>. 
</p><p>
DEAR SIR: 
</p><p>
<a href='/results.php?tla=nag' rel='colleague met'>Gen. Greene</a> has this moment received information that a detachment 
of the enemy are gone up Cooper River; their object is not ascertained. 
It is said to consist of more than 400 men, and that they left town yesterday noon. The General desires me to transmit you the information 
for your security. 
</p><p>
I am, respectfully yours, 
</p><p>
<a href="/results.php?tla=jbu" rel="me">J. BURNET</a>, Aide-decamp. 
</p>
</letter>
